channel.title: Build a server mac os x
channel.description:
i have a mac with the operating sytem mac os x is there any way i can host ore make a server ? cus i cant find jave for mac the only thing i have is aple scripti dont now if its the sam so any wan using a mac ple help me[br][size=1]Posted on: June 13, 2007, 07:41:18 AM[/size][hr]bumb
sry for that

item.title: Build a server mac os x
item.dc:creator: @Oh_Noes_PIERATS Oh Noes! PIERATS!
item.description:
@Oh_Noes_PIERATS wrote:

<3 google.

You dont need to download it lul.

Java has become the de-facto standard language for developing cross-platform applications. Recognizing this, Apple has made Java a core component of Mac OS X. Mac OS X includes the full version of Java 2, Standard Edition — meaning you have the Java Developer Kit (JDK) and the HotSpot virtual machine (VM) without downloading, installing or configuring anything. And because Apple has optimized Java on Mac OS X, Java applications act as first-class citizens on Mac OS X

Read full topic

item.title: Build a server mac os x
item.dc:creator: @Oh_Noes_PIERATS Oh Noes! PIERATS!
item.description:
@Oh_Noes_PIERATS wrote:

emo pixel:

Well you could host it on hamachi because theres such thing as “Hamachi X” for mac but the onyl problem would be finding a mac program that can run BATCH files, if you can find one then you can hamachi host :] hope i helped.

lelel all you have to do is convert from Batch to BAsh script.

cant remember exactly but it would be something like

#!bin/BAsh
crap here lol
